name: Moltres

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

strengths: Wildfire can mill opponent's deck as an alternate win condition
Basic Pokemon with 70 HP is solid
Dive Bomb can do 80 damage for a potential OHKO
weaknesses: Dive Bomb is coin flip dependent - 50% chance to do nothing
Wildfire requires discarding your own energy
4 energy for Dive Bomb is expensive
Mill strategy is slow and inconsistent
counters: Aggressive decks that win before mill matters

competitiveHistory: Fossil Moltres offered a unique mill strategy with Wildfire, allowing players to attack the opponent's deck as a win condition. However, this strategy was generally too slow and inconsistent for competitive play. Dive Bomb's coin flip made it unreliable as a primary attacker. The card saw occasional play in stall and control decks but was not a tournament staple.

rulings.ruling: Wildfire allows you to discard 0 Fire Energy, in which case no cards are discarded from opponent's deck.
The Fire Energy must be discarded from Moltres, not from your hand or other Pokemon.
If Dive Bomb's coin flip is tails, no damage is dealt at all - the attack completely fails.
If opponent's deck has fewer cards than Fire Energy you discarded, discard all remaining cards in their deck.
